page.title: 19HOUSING IN SHAFTON
page.content: Most of the houses across the road from the school have{bay windows}that stick out from the house wall; these houses were{built in the 1930's}and are built{of bricks}and have{tiled {roofs.}Most of the very{old houses}are built{of stone}and have{slate {roofs}like the{school}which was built in{1911.}Some have leaded lights or windows made of small pieces of glass joined together with strips of lead. Some houses have space for a car to get up the side to a garage but many are too close together for that. Most of them have{gardens}of different sizes. Many of the houses near school {terraced,}some are{semi-detached and a few are{detached.}There are some council houses which were built in the 1920's but the{newest houses}are the private ones built behind the school in the{1970's.
